### CURRENT RESEARCH EXPERIENCE

#### Research Assistant

***Department of Applied Economics, University of Minnesota*** [June 2024 -- Present]{.cvdate}

Supervised by Dr. Justin Johnson

- Developed "A Framework for Measuring African Ecosystem Services Impacts from Land-Related Policies" with collaborators from the European Commission Joint Research Centre, and Wageningen University & Research.

- Contributed to the development of an integrated modeling framework combining a computable general equilibrium (CGE) model with spatially explicit ecosystem service models to evaluate the economic and ecological consequences of land use change in Kenya, with a focus on policy goals related to carbon storage, pollination services, and spatially targeted restoration and protection.

- Utilized Python and geospatial tools (SEALS, InVEST) to simulate land allocations, analyze ecosystem service outcomes, and assess policy impacts aligned with Kenyaâ€™s climate and biodiversity goals.
